P3D package¶

Submodules¶

P3D.graphing module¶

class P3D.graphing.Figure(data: List[Trace] = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Figure

A figure. This extends plotly.graph_objects.Figure.

Creates a figure

Parameters:

data – List of plotly.graph_objects.Trace for this figure to have

update_bounds(x: List[float] = None, y: List[float] = None, z: List[float] = None) → None[source]¶

Updates the bounds for this figure

Parameters:

  • x – Bounds that can be updated, if provided, as a list of 2 numbers

  • y – Bounds that can be updated, if provided, as a list of 2 numbers

  • z – Bounds that can be updated, if provided, as a list of 2 numbers

add_slider(slider_values: List[float], traces: List[Trace | List[Trace]], initial_step: int = 0, prefix: str = 't: ') → None[source]¶

Adds a new slider to this figure

Parameters:

  • slider_values – List of N values the slider should have

  • traces – List of plotly.graph_objects.Trace to add, and which slider value they should be visible on. Each element can be a list itself, meaning multiple traces are visible on that value

  • initial_step – Which step (0 to N-1) to start the slider on

  • prefix – how each step on the slider is labelled

type() → Literal['2d', '3d'][source]¶

Returns what type of figure this is

Return type:

The type of figure this is, as a string

class P3D.graphing.Surface(x: ndarray[floating], y: ndarray[floating], z: ndarray[floating], showscale: bool = False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Surface

A 3D Surface This extends plotly.graph_objects.Figure.

Creates a 3D surface

Parameters:

  • x – 2D arrays all of the same shape. Each ordered triple is a point on the surface

  • y – 2D arrays all of the same shape. Each ordered triple is a point on the surface

  • z – 2D arrays all of the same shape. Each ordered triple is a point on the surface

  • showscale – Whether to show the colorbar on the side

class P3D.graphing.Line(x: ndarray[floating], y: ndarray[floating], z: ndarray[floating] = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Creates a new 2d (plotly.graph_objects.Scatter) or 3d (plotly.graph_objects.Scatter3d) line.

Parameters:

  • x – 1d arrays all of the same length. If z is provided, the line is 3d, else it is 2d.

  • y – 1d arrays all of the same length. If z is provided, the line is 3d, else it is 2d.

  • z – 1d arrays all of the same length. If z is provided, the line is 3d, else it is 2d.

P3D.webpage module¶

class P3D.webpage.Webpage(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Dash

A Dash webpage, extends dash.Dash

Creates A Dash webpage

class P3D.webpage.Graph(figure: Figure = None, id: str = None, height: float = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Graph

Graph component for webpage, extends dash.dcc.Graph

Creates a graph component for webpage

Parameters:

  • figure – The plotly.graph_objects.Figure to use in this graph

  • id – the unique id to identify this graph with

  • height – the proportion of the height of the window to take up; 0 to 1

class P3D.webpage.DataTable(columns: List[str] = [], data: List[List | Dict] = [], id: str = None, height: float = None, column_ids: Dict[str | int, str] | List[str] = {}, properties: Dict[str, any] = {}, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: DataTable

Table component for webpage, extends dash.dash_table.DataTable

Creates a table component for webpage

Parameters:

  • columns – List of columns to use. Each element is the column’s name and default id

  • data – Each element of list is one row of the table. Element can be a list of values based upon column order, or a dictionary of values with keys as column ids

  • id – the unique id to identify this table with

  • height – the proportion of the height of the window to take up; 0 to 1

  • column_ids – ids to use instead of default ids. Can specify column by its name or index. Alternatively list of ids, in same order as names

  • properties – Assigns properties to columns. Each key is a property, and each value is what columns has that property. Value can be True, meaning to apply to all columns. Value can be a list of indices and/or ids to choose columns. Common properties are editable, renamable, deletable, and clearable.

class P3D.webpage.TextArea(value: str = None, id: str = None, height: float = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Textarea

A text input area, extends dash.dcc.TextArea

Creates A text input area

Parameters:

  • value – The initial text inside of this textbox

  • id – the unique id to identify this textarea with

  • height – the proportion of the height of the window to take up; 0 to 1

static convert(text: str, as_string: bool = True) → str | Expr[source]¶

Converts a normal math expression to a Python math expression

Parameters:

  • text – the text to convert

  • as_string – whether to return the raw sympy expression output, or the string output

static evaluate(text: str, variables: Dict[str, any]) → any[source]¶

Evaluates a normal math expression using the values of the variables given.

Parameters:

  • text – the math expression to evaluate

  • variables – dictionary of variables names and their values

static latex(text) → str[source]¶

Converts a normal math expression into a latex formula

Parameters:

text – the math expression to convert

create_Markdown(app: Dash, id: str = None, height: float = None, **kwargs) → Markdown[source]¶

Creates a markdown area that renders all text in this into a nice format.

Parameters:

  • app – the dash.Dash app that will have both the textarea and the markdown area

  • id – the unique id to identify this markdown with

  • height – the proportion of the height of the window to take up; 0 to 1

class P3D.webpage.Slider(min: float = 0, max: float = 1, value: float = None, step: float = None, marks: dict | None = {}, id: str = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Slider

A text input area, extends dash.dcc.Slider

Creates A Dash Slider

Parameters:

  • min – bounds on the slider

  • max – bounds on the slider

  • value – initial value for slider

  • step – spacing between each step on slider

  • marks – optional dictionary to provide exact steps and labels; set to None for no labels at all

  • id – the unique id to identify this slider with
